enigma_edit.model

Class Tileset

  • java.lang.Object
    • enigma_edit.model.Tileset
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Tileset.Group>

    public class Tileset
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Tileset.Group>
    Collection of all available kinds of objects. This class provides the data, necessary for the correct rendering of all kinds of Enigma-objects, as well as the necessary data for attribute and message editing. The actual data will normally be provided by an XML- description file, that is parsed by an instance of TilesetReader.

        public void loadSprites(SpriteSet spriteset)
                 throws MissingImageException
        Creates a sprite for each Tileset.Image instance through the given SpriteSet.
        Parameters:
        spriteset - the SpriteSet implementation to use for image loading
        Throws:
        MissingImageException - Indicates that an image file is missing.

      • check

        public void check()
           throws MissingStringException
        Check, if the <i18n> section contains all referenced strings. Everything that has a textual representation within the user interface will be checked for a corresponding entry in the <i18n> section. On failure an instance of MissingStringException is thrown.
        Throws:
        MissingStringException - The value of an i18n attribute or an implicit i18n-identifier is missing from the <i18n> section of the tile-set description file.

      • resolve

        public java.util.ArrayList<Tileset.VarImage> resolve(TilePart.Construct construct,
                                                     Mode2 mode)
        Resolves a lua table to the Tileset.Variant as declared by this tileset.
        Parameters:
        construct - Tile constructor to be resolved.
        mode - Mode to use for resolving.
        Returns:
        The corresponding variant (or stack of variants).

      • dump

        public void dump()
          throws MissingStringException
        Dump tile-set contents (for debugging purposes).
        Throws:
        MissingStringException - The value of an i18n attribute or an implicit i18n-identifier is missing from the <i18n> section of the tile-set description file.
